subtitles_text: >> JEFF: Previously on Survivor:
>> Oh, my God! >> JEFF: The tribes competed
to build the best shelter, which led Chapera to question Rob C's
work ethic. >> Where have you been?
>> I got lost in the jungle. >> ROB M.: it seems like he's on
a never-ending coffee break. >> ROB C.: You want to get more
rocks? >> ALICIA: You want to get more
rocks. >> ROB C.: Okay.
>> JEFF: At Saboga, Rupert and Jerri clashed over Rupert's
underground shelter design. >> JERRI: I don't feel digging
into the ground is a good idea. >> RUPERT: I know what I can do.
I'm 40 years old. I've built houses for 20 years.
>> Let's just... do it. >> JEFF: On judgment day,
Rupert's stubbornness cost his tribe.
You would not want to live here? >> Oh, no.
>> ETHAN: I don't think he likes it.
>> JEFF: Chapera's shelter secured them a victory and a
bounty of comfort. >> ROB M.: Get that wine open,
let's go. >> JEFF: At the celebration,
Rob and Amber's alliance heated up.
>> AMBER: If you're going to kiss me, kiss me now because I'm
not kissing you with nasty breath later on.
>> ROB M.: Whoa. >> JEFF: At Mogo Mogo, Jenna
started to fade from the game. >> JENNA: I have a lot to lose
being here, like my mom. She's had cancer for a long time
and I'm just afraid that she might pass away while I'm here.
>> JEFF: When the tribes arrived at the immunity
challenge, Jenna made a tough decision.
>> JENNA: Due to someone who's very ill at home right now, I
need to pull myself out of the game.
>> JEFF: This is a big action, and it could have a big impact
on this game. With Jenna's departure, Mogo
Mogo lost their first member. 15 are left.
Who will be voted out tonight? Captioning sponsored by
CBS PARAMOUNT NETWORK TELEVISION
\xe2\x99\xaa \xe2\x99\xaa ( thunder crashing )
>> TOM: We need a boat. We need a boat bad.
Mayday! Mayday! Mayday! >> We are in a little river.
Rio Peque\xc3\xb1o. That's the name of the camp
today. >> ALICIA: I knew that it was
rainy season in Panama, but I didn't realize that rainy season
meant, like, torrential downpours that flood your whole
entire camp. >> SUE: Who would have ever
thought? You can actually see it flowing
through the studs of the house. >> AMBER: We have constructed a
shelter that is pretty unbelievable.
We used everything possible that we got from our reward.
We put the parachute as a wall, we have the tarp on top.
>> ROB M.: The shelter held up pretty good.
The water was a little bit excessive, though.
It ended up coming up through the floor.
We weren't really predicting for that to happen.
However, I slept almost all night long, 'cause I was under
the blanket. I was warm, and I just slept the
whole night. >> AMBER: You're so warm.
>> TOM: Rob and Amber were laying on the thing kind of
getting a romantic mood. Maybe the rain was just an
excuse to maybe snuggle a little closer.
>> ROB C.: Boston Rob and Amber are going to do it.
I don't know when, but they're going to do it.
They've got the mat, the pillows.
Everything is in place, and I really wish those two the best
of luck. >> RUPERT: Our beach is
destroyed, that stupid shelter that I built is destroyed.
Digging into the sand is the dumbest idea I've ever had in my
life. And we paid dearly tonight for
it. It's now underwater, and we are
homeless. And I got to build us another
shelter today, something today. >> JERRI: We've been shivering
in the rain probably five or six hours, if not more.
It's a disaster. The rain just started pouring,
and the whole shelter filled up with water.
The entire thing. The hole that Rupert thought was
so brilliant to dig, filled up with water.
This never would have happened if they hadn't dug that hole.
(sobbing): It's not worth it. >> RUPERT: That storm was
insanely hard. It was rough this morning, it
was rough last night. >> ETHAN: Other than the time
father passed away, I think that was the worst night of my life.
Hands down. It was horrible.
Some of us thought people were going to come and rescue us.
I'm like, "They're not going to rescue us.
What are you, nuts?" I'm like, "This is Survivor."
It's our own fault this we built a crappy old shelter.
>> JENNA L.: It's not raining at out there.
Come on. You have to start warming up.
I promise you it's warmer out here.
I'm in a bathing suit. It's dripping and wet in here.
>> JERRI: I don't have a clue what's going on at camp, other
than disassembling our old shelter.
I don't know where they plan on moving it, or what they plan on
doing with it. As far as I'm concerned, I
couldn't give a rat's ass at this point.
I don't even care. >> RUPERT: You want any?
>> JENNA L.: Drink some. Come on.
It's good for you. >> RUPERT: It is good for you.
If Jerri warms up and feels better and soaks a little of
daylight in her, she'll be fine, too.
But the plan today is, we got to make shelter, we got to make
fire, and we got to get it together now.
>> SHII ANN: Look how much it rained.
>> COLBY: I'm glad we set that out.
>> KATHY: Oh, good. >> LEX: Good, good, good.
>> SHII ANN: Last night was one of those moments when you

>> KATHY: We'll have to come up with a really good lean-to and a

>> KATHY: You know, you think you're a veteran at this game

>> COLBY: What have you got? >> RICHARD: Today was a nice

you know, meat-chunked moray eels.

( applause ) >> And what's that one in the

>> LEX: After we cooked and cleaned these eels, there must

>> RICHARD: I was feeding you, honey.

We thought for today's reward challenge, we would give you a

Here's how it's going to work: each tribe member will have
their own station. Inside each station are four
items relating to island living. Your goal is to find another
tribe member who has a matching item.
Every time you get a match, you score a point for your tribe.
You can match an item with somebody from your own tribe.
You can match an item with somebody from another tribe.
Doesn't matter. When you find a match, you score
a point. The tribe who scores the most
correct matches wins reward. One more thing: you let somebody

Want to know what your playing for?
